course.subject: ENVR
course.name: Introductory Environmental and Health Economics
course.description: This course introduces students to basic theories and findings in environmental and health economics. The emphasis is on how the economic models and concepts can be used to analyze environmental and health issues. The course begins with an introduction of theoretical economic concepts and models; then it moves on to several policy-relevant environmental and health topics. Particular issues include externality, common goods and public goods, valuation of environmental goods and health, market failure and health, environmental regulations, pollution and health, and the economics of climate change.
course.exclusions: ECON 2310, SOSC 2310

reviews.author: Playep
reviews.title: Good grades, nice professor, but only take it if you have prior Economics background
reviews.comment_content:
*Only take this course if you have prior economics background!*

I studied Economics in high school and I struggled to understand all of it, not because it's difficult but because of the sheer amount of concepts and theories taught. It's especially worsened when there is no midterm - i.e. you have 20 powerpoints of almost 50 pages each to memorize.

News Article Analysis replaced the midterm apparently, but tbh I'd rather have a mid term instead.

However, putting the amount of content aside, i did find most of the stuff taught pretty interesting. I do recommend this course if you have any interest in environmental policies or politics. Prof didn't dive too deep into those concepts and kept it easy enough to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor was enthusiastic in his teaching, he prepares a lot of materials and additional videos for us. I had a few questions regarding certain topics and he quickly responded to my emails, arranging a meeting first with the TA (who was helpful), and then himself.

One thing to note is that his accent is considered a bit on the heavy side - I could understand it but some people may fail to. The TA I met with is from Japanese, and his accent isn't much better either if I'm honest. But again, not so bad that I cannot make out what they're saying. There are definitely worse accents in UST, and by that I mean a lot worse. (Looking at you, Du Lil*n from ISOM department)
reviews.comment_grading:
The average score for assignments were quite high, I believe since most people had economics background. Final was rather rushed, so the mean was significantly lower (Prof did mention he didn't expect us to finish all of it - you'll see it reflected in the grade below).

Prof gave leng grades (he gave good grades) - after final he handed out his scoring percentages and he used up the quota for A & B (20% and 40% respectively).

Assignment 1: 94/100 - Mean 93.4
Assignment 2: 93/100 - Mean 88.5
Assignment 3: 96/100 - Mean 91.4
Assignment 4: 91/100 - Mean 88.8
News Article Analysis: 82/100 - Mean 81.8
Final Exam: 66/100 - Mean 57.8 - SD: 15.5

Final Grade: B+

I'm pretty satisfied with his grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
There was an assignment every 2 week (total of 4), which isn't too much. One assignment would take about an hour or more to complete but honestly it could've been worse. News Article Analysis had a limit of 6 pages I think so the pressure isn't on you to write as much as you could.

In general, the assignments can be completed without much issue if you understood most of what he taught in class. There are some additional mathematical concepts that will be introduced in the assignments but they're easy enough that my dumbass could figure them out on my own.

Since there was no mid term, the studying workload for the final is massive (mentioned in Content section).

reviews.author: annaaa
reviews.title: Nice professor
reviews.comment_content:
the first half part of the course topics is exactly the content of HKDSE econ one
If you have studied econ in your high school, those topics are very easy. But the later half is new one. Not difficult to understand as the professor explain in quite detail

Principles of Economics
Supply, Demand and Market Equilibrium
Comparative Statics
Consumer Surplus and Producer Surplus
Welfare Analysis
Social Optimum and Economic Efficiency
Externalities
Coase Theorem and Discussions
Common Resources
Public Goods
Political Economy of Public Goods Provision and Discussions
Valuing the Environment: Revealed Preference and Stated
Preference
VSL
Benefit and Cost Analysis
Pollution and Health
Documentary Film
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is very nice. You can see he is very passionate in teaching us.
The class is conducted via zoom.
He try to make us more interactive but seems a bit failed haha

all in all, he is quite nice. He does not have a strong accent!
reviews.comment_grading:
all slightly higher than the mean-> B

mean of assignment: 4.8/5
final:68/100 (mean65.4)
report:29/35(mean28.9)

seems most of the students have econ background, so the marks are quite high.
reviews.comment_workload:
assignment x4
no midterm
have to do a report before the date of the final
(the report is quite easy, you can either chose a theme with econ concepts or do the documentary film report)

the overall workload is not very big

reviews.author: ycssme
reviews.comment_content:
Basic microeconomics, like demand and supply, efficiency.
Plus some materials related to environmental science, like asymmetric information, government policies for environmental protection.
If you have learnt economics before, it should not be a problem for economics part.
reviews.comment_teaching: It is easy to follow professor's speed, and he will explain concepts through mini games, or some other activities. You can also ask him after class for any questions, he is a very patient teacher.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is not bad.
If you perform not well in mid-term, you still have a chance to get a better grade when you perform well in final. The grading formula is not fixed.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are 5 assignments in total, plus 2 news article analysis.
To me, a few of them are easy, but, some are very difficult. So it takes you time to finish them unless you learn economics well.

reviews.author: Marian
reviews.title: Introductory Environmental and Health Economics
reviews.comment_content: Basic Econ knowledge, supply demand, elasticity, tax, externality, Monopoly....there are very small proportion of environmental topics. Basically the midterm and final mainly test your econ knowledge.  there would be definition questions (which requires you to write down the definition of several terms), some true false questions and long questions.
reviews.comment_teaching: although he is from mainland China,he has a decent accent, pretty easy to follow. he would spend time on definition.
reviews.comment_grading:
my situation:
first time learning econ, below mean during the midterm and slightly above mean during the final,
Eventually gain B.
reviews.comment_workload: there were 5 assignments and 1-2 classwork. 2 news analysis in total.
